title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 January 2014 - XWiki
content:

10:17 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <vmassol> good morning  
10:37 <cjd> gm  
10:37 <vmassol> I'm quite happy about my live preview demo for xwiki rendering, works great! :)  
10:37 <vmassol> (https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/angular-rendering/tree/master )  
10:37 <vmassol> it's fun to see the live rendering as you type  
10:37 <cjd> cute  
10:37 <vmassol> and the best is that it's very little code to achieve all of this  
10:37 <vmassol> java part is just one file: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/angular-rendering/blob/master/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/rendering/RenderingResource.java  
10:38 <vmassol> and the html/js part is also just one file: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/angular-rendering/blob/master/src/main/webapp/index.html  
10:39 <vmassol> I'm using webjars btw :) this is so cool with maven  
10:39 <vmassol> the pom is pretty simple too: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/angular-rendering/blob/master/pom.xml  
10:39 <tmortagne> vmassol: "Livew preview" link does not seems to work  
10:39 <vmassol> where thomas?  
10:40 <tmortagne> at the end of your readme  
10:40 <tmortagne> getting "Access denied."  
10:40 <vmassol> ah works for me ofc  
10:40 <vmassol> it's a link to my evernote account  
10:40 <vmassol> checking  
10:40 <vmassol> strange it's sahred  
10:40 <vmassol> does this work for you: https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/d45e2995-475d-4140-b9a1-d13557112f20/f4267f1baa155e17f942a952863efa00  
10:40 <vmassol> ?  
10:41 <tmortagne> yes  
10:41 <vmassol> and this: https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/d45e2995-475d-4140-b9a1-d13557112f20/f4267f1baa155e17f942a952863efa00/res/0ddf817b-a592-4414-b4f5-246af380b497/skitch.png  
10:41 <vmassol> ?  
10:41 <tmortagne> yes  
10:41 <vmassol> then it should work I don't get it  
10:42 <tmortagne> ha seems to work now  
10:42 <tmortagne> maybe there was a delay or something  
10:42 <vmassol> strange  
10:42 <tmortagne> yep if I refresh the page with the error I don't have it anymore  
10:42 <vmassol> ok  
10:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: need to update http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HDemo now ;)  
10:43 <vmassol> yeah I thought about it but it's not easy, that would require to add support for several things in xwiki  
10:43 <vmassol> s/not easy/not that easy/  
10:43 <vmassol> it's doable though  
10:44 <vmassol> (with a bit of hackery)  
10:44 <woshilapin> Hi, how can I get a compiled version of XWiki and be sure that it includes this commit  
10:44 <woshilapin> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f6d2ed31f51d139c9aa44f78e9b992bbfae12fe5  
10:44 <vmassol> woshilapin: download the latest snapshot for example  
10:44 <woshilapin> Where?  
10:44 <woshilapin> maven.xwiki.org ?  
10:45 <woshilapin> I'll be sure that the commit is inside?  
10:45 <vmassol> http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download  
10:45 <vmassol> there's a link at the end  
10:45 <vmassol> (it points to http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/ )  
10:45 <vmassol> then it depends what distribution you wish to get  
10:46 <vmassol> actually  
10:46 <vmassol> all the links are mentioned there  
10:46 <vmassol> the section is called "Development Builds"  
10:46 <vmassol> and yes you'll have this commit  
10:46 <tmortagne> vmassol: not so sure with current jenkins state  
10:47 <woshilapin> OK, thanks  
10:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: this commit is 5 days old  
10:47 <woshilapin> The commit has been done on the master branch 5 days ago...  
10:48 <vmassol> and platform built successfully this morning  
10:48 <vmassol> (and enterprise too)  
10:48 <vmassol> you should be safe woshilapin  
10:48 <vmassol> ah wait  
10:48 <tmortagne> last XE build is not very recent  
10:48 <vmassol> enterprise didn't build  
10:48 <vmassol> hmm  
10:48 <vmassol> strange  
10:48 <vmassol> how come  
10:48 <tmortagne> probably because of commons  
10:49 <vmassol> but since platform built  
10:49 <vmassol> it should have triggered it  
10:49 <vmassol> triggering a build for you now woshilapin  
10:49 <vmassol> now it built on the 8th so you should be ok anyway  
10:49 <tmortagne> maybe he rigger get canceled when one of the dependencies is failing  
10:49 <tmortagne> \*the trigger  
10:50 <woshilapin> All of this to try to reproduce a bug with the last bug fixes on subwikis functionalities...  
10:50 <woshilapin> :-\  
10:51 <vmassol> do I know you woshilapin? :)  
10:52 <cjd> nobody knows woshilapin  
10:53 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <woshilapin> Well, you may know me :-) I'm in your desk!  
10:53 <vmassol> from his questions he looks very similar to Jean Simard  
10:53 <cjd> /whois woshilapin  
10:54 <woshilapin> Yes, you got it!  
10:54 <vmassol> come on Jean use a proper name so that we know it's you…. :)  
10:55 <cjd> heh names can be faked, the ip address is authoritative :)  
10:55 <woshilapin>  /whois is here for that  
10:56 <vmassol> this is not a hacker channel no need for fake names to hide your identity! I personally don't like answering to people who hide their names. Why would I help them when they make life more complex for me by removing all context information  
10:56 <vmassol> if I knew it were you, I'd have answered differentlt because we've already discussed in the past  
10:56 <vmassol> so I know your knwoledge, what you don't know already, etc  
10:57 <vmassol> and keeping a map of aliases in my small head is hard…  
10:57 <woshilapin> And? I don't hide it, I'm just tired of changing my pseudo for each new account (simard is a very common name in Canada)  
10:58 <cjd> 10:57 [freenode] -!- Nick jts is already in use  
10:58 <cjd> boo freenode  
10:58 <vmassol> ok then I'm tired of answering you  
10:58 <vmassol> simple enough  
10:58 <vmassol> :)  
10:58 <vmassol> good luck!  
10:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
11:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: are you sure it's a good idea? It won't lead to too much business code in wiki pages instead of having Script services for that? Also maybe we should raise an issue on the velocity side about it?  
11:02 <vmassol> maybe they had a reason and if not they should be ok to implement it I guess  
11:02 <tmortagne> would not make much sens as script service, only Velocity have these limitations  
11:03 <vmassol> it's not about veloicity nor limitation  
11:03 <vmassol> it's about offereing a higher level api to do whatever is needed  
11:03 <tmortagne> Class already have theses method, all other script langues can use it, only Velocity cannot  
11:04 <vmassol> the more power we give to veloicity the more people will use it to code business logic  
11:04 <tmortagne> there is no need to invent new APIs  
11:04 <vmassol> yes and that's why velocity is nicer than groovy and other scripting languages  
11:04 <vmassol> because you can do less  
11:04 <vmassol> I agree it's more a question of best practices  
11:04 <tmortagne> those limitation are useless, they don't cause any security issue  
11:04 <vmassol> but I'm more worried that if you introduce them it means you're going to use them :)  
11:04 <tmortagne> yes that's the plan  
11:05 <vmassol> ok I'm curious to see the use case  
11:05 <tmortagne> like we use automatic parameters convertions  
11:05 <vmassol> conversion is not business logic  
11:05 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <vmassol> I'm not saying they're bad, I don't know, I guess it'll depend on the use cases  
11:06 <vmassol> if it's a use case  
11:06 <vmassol> for displaying stuff  
11:06 <vmassol> it should be ok I guess  
11:06 <vmassol> in anyc ase don't you think  
11:06 <vmassol> that the velocity project should do this change too?  
11:06 <tmortagne> we often need to check if an object implement some class, right now we are doing hack with class name but if it's a extends it does not work  
11:08 <tmortagne> yes IMO they should do that change (or most probably add configuration for methods like there is for packages and class names)  
11:08 <tmortagne> I just added a few useful methods here, did not really reviewed all Class methods to analyze we one to enable  
11:09 <tmortagne> s/we/which/  
11:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: just commented at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/cec4ea36061bdc186838a0034806fd98a218c203#commitcomment-5060660  
11:19 <vmassol> just added one more comment  
11:20 <vmassol> I think it could have been ok in 6.0 but I'm close to -1 for (.4  
11:20 <vmassol> 5.4  
11:20 <vmassol> waiting for other's opinions  
11:20 <vmassol> mflorea, Denis, lucaa, others: any opinion?  
11:22 <lucaa> vmassol: lemme read  
11:22 <Denis> vmassol, tmortagne: what will be the usage of those methods ?  
11:22 <tmortagne> Denis: (11:06:45 AM) tmortagne: we often need to check if an object implement some class, right now we are doing hack with class name but if it's a extends it does not work  
11:22 <vmassol> hmm actually I may be wrong, you've changed a default right?  
11:22 <Denis> yep, but where do expect to use it now ?  
11:23 <vmassol> so if users haven't uncommented the property they don't need to update their xwiki.properties  
11:23 <vmassol> right?  
11:23 <tmortagne> things like isEnum/isPrimitive/etc are also useful for me to simplify a bit wikistream UI  
11:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: the property is commented so yes https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/cec4ea36061bdc186838a0034806fd98a218c203 does not change anything, like I said in the comment it's just documentation  
11:24 <vmassol>  my issue was more about the upgrade issue but if it's a property that is usually uncommented it's less of an issue  
11:24 <vmassol> now  
11:24 <vmassol> it's still an issue  
11:25 <vmassol> becuase on severla instances, we uncomment this property  
11:25 <vmassol> in order to remove the deprecated uberspector  
11:25 <vmassol> it's actually a production recommendation  
11:25 <vmassol> to avoid filling the logs  
11:25 <vmassol> and I know GF is doing it too on production instances  
11:26 <Denis> right, but according to the fact that we have no intends to use this in many places, only wiki streams, it reduce the impact IMO  
11:26 <tmortagne> IMO we should introduce an enable/disable switch for the deprecated uberspector, it's simpler modifying this property is dangerous  
11:26 <vmassol> wiki stream is used everywhere Denis  
11:26 <Denis> the UI ?  
11:26 <vmassol> import, export, etc  
11:26 <vmassol> ah  
11:27 <tmortagne> Denis: it's not only about wikistream, like I said we have various hacks based on the class name instead of proper instanceof-like check  
11:27 <tmortagne> and for example I will need for displaying the log tree  
11:29 <vmassol> guys I'm going to try upgrading jenkins to 1.547 which supposedly fixed the issue we had in 546  
11:29 <Denis> anyway, the migration recommandation which are as valuable as the production recommandation says that you have to merge your configuration files, so, is this recommandation not valid for stabilisation releases ?  
11:29 <tmortagne> again it's all useful methods with no security concern, there was no reason for them to be disabled by default and I don't even see why we are arguing about the most standard methods in Java...  
11:29 <vmassol> Denis: it's about making it easy for users  
11:29 <vmassol> (and most of them don't read RN or not to that extent and they'd need to read ALL RN)  
11:30 <Denis> users uncommenting that config line are already somehow advanced users  
11:30 <vmassol> if we can make it easier for users we should IMO  
11:30 <vmassol> because I know for sure a big majority (of those who uncommtned this line) will have failures because of this  
11:30 <Denis> I would have agreed with you if it was uncommented by default  
11:30 <vmassol> including xwiki sas platform guys ;)  
11:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: org.xwiki.velocity.introspection.MethodArgumentsUberspector is not very old and I don't remember any upgrade complain about it  
11:32 <vmassol> this is the converter for method param?  
11:33 <tmortagne> yes  
11:33 <vmassol> yes and the reason we did'nt get complain I think  
11:33 <vmassol> is because we started removing the deprecatdd upberspector in production only after  
11:33 <vmassol> maybe xwiki sas is currently the only one doing this :)  
11:34 <vmassol> in any case, I don't want to veto it so I'll go with the flow but for sure it needs to be added in the upgrade section  
11:34 <vmassol> (of the RN)  
11:38 <lucaa> vmassol: I don't have a strong opinion, in general when I upgrade things I check the differences in xwiki.properties for this very reason. If it cannot have side effects, as in things that used to mean something will now mean something else because some new functions were "enabled", then I don't necessarrily -1 it  
11:40 <vmassol> lucaa: yes I'd have agreed too if it were not the last release of the 5.x cycle but ok, I may be too protective but that's a good thing too since we need to be careful, so it allows us to discuss it and at least now you're all aware of this potential issue ;)  
11:40 <lucaa> (12:33:47 PM) vmassol: is because we started removing the deprecatdd upberspector in production only after  
11:40 <lucaa> Deprecated warnings can be muted? And you tell me that just now?  
11:40 <vmassol> lucaa: :)  
11:40 <vmassol> it's even a FAQ  
11:40 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+to+avoid+deprecated+messages+in+the+logs  
11:41 <vmassol> BTW tmortagne this FAQ will need to be updated too I guess  
11:41 <vmassol> and all places on xwiki.org mentioning the old uberspector  
11:42 <cjd> ./start\_xwiki.sh --I-like-it-when-things-fail-during-upgrade-mute-deprecation-warnings  
11:42 <tmortagne> I doubt much places mention "org.apache.velocity.util.introspection.SecureUberspector"  
11:42 <vmassol> not probably not a lot  
11:43 <vmassol> I know one (the FAQ) maybe there are others  
11:43 <tmortagne> they probably talk about the secure uberspector in general  
11:43 <vmassol> maybe in the velocity module doc  
11:43 <cjd> actually on the topic of deprecation, I think we ought to consider \*removing\* some of the deprecation tags on methods since we have zillions of deprecated methods which are still used more or less constantly and we have no plan to remove them  
11:43 <tmortagne> the FAQ should probably indicate to remove the DeprecatedCheckUberspector instead  
11:43 <vmassol> yes but it needs an example  
11:43 <vmassol> it's much simpler for the user  
11:44 <vmassol> cjd: :)  
11:44 <lucaa> cjd: ./start\_xwiki.sh --OK,-come-on-my-wiki-and-refactor-all-code-to-not-use-$msg.get-anymore  
11:44 <vmassol> removing deprecation is not a good idea IMO when we wish to go the other way  
11:44 <tmortagne> there is no code in XE that uses $msg  
11:44 <cjd> hehe  
11:44 <cjd> maybe msg.get should be targetted for undeprecation :D  
11:45 <vmassol> there's an unclosed discussison about this one  
11:45 <vmassol> to make it simpler to add translations  
11:45 <vmassol> $services.localization.render(…) is a bit cumbersome  
11:45 <vmassol> I think it was raised by Edy  
11:45 <vmassol> but we didn't finish the discussion  
11:46 <cjd> $services was a bad choice of name because it makes everything long  
11:46 <lucaa> vmassol: I think you're sliding away from the main topic  
11:46 <vmassol> I am  
11:46 <vmassol> but not my fault  
11:46 <vmassol> cjd pushed me!  
11:46 <vmassol> :)  
11:47 <cjd> brainhacking vulnerability  
11:47 <vmassol> next step is brain inception ;)  
11:47 <lucaa> so, so vmassol: i don't want the xcommons issue merged in 5.4. I'm just saying that, as part of my xwikisas job of preparing upgrades, I always check config files changes and prepare a 3 way merge if needed. Now, I try to instruct everybody to do the same, but I cannot guarantee that everybody will do it properly.  
11:48 <lucaa> if you don't wanna put it, don't put it in 5.4. If you wanna put it, we have some mechanisms to prevent such situations.  
11:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: done for the FAQ entry. It's slightly less easy to follow it but it should be ok enough  
11:55 <tmortagne> note that this entry is not true for all released versions (wrong class name)  
11:55 <tmortagne> forget that  
11:55 <vmassol> ok, had a hard time understanding :)  
11:57 <cjd> has quit  
11:59 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <mflorea> has quit  
12:05 <vmassol> guys, we cannot restore a deleted attachment?  
12:05 <vmassol> (I'm surprised)  
12:06 <cjd> you can  
12:06 <cjd> you rollback the page to prior to deletion  
12:06 <vmassol> I don't get the icon for it  
12:06 <vmassol> ah indeed  
12:06 <vmassol> so it's not an operaiton done in the index app  
12:06 <cjd> but yeah, we should have a nice ui for that  
12:06 <vmassol> I'll document it  
12:11 <Denis> vmassol, cjd: it depends of the config, and if attachements versioning is active, isn't it ?  
12:11 <vmassol> Denis: I've tested on playgorund and they're all active AFAIK  
12:11 <vmassol> just created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9878  
12:12 <Denis> sure, I means the workaround mentioned by cjd only works is attachement versioning is active  
12:14 <vmassol> Denis: ok, I don't know about that  
12:16 <Denis> vmassol: storage of attachement list and content has always been something I dislike, and having both properly in sync is still an issue  
12:18 <vmassol> yep  
12:35 <andreeapopescu> has quit

14:53 <vmassol> ok ci updated, forcing a rebuild of commons to verify it works now  
15:05 <cjd> has quit  
15:12 <vmassol> success :)  
15:13 <tmortagne> cool  
15:17 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:19 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:35 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:41 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol: could you tell me why are we still keeping http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/fveron/ideas/ if we already have newer versions on http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/contrib/application-ideas/ ?  
15:49 <tmortagne> sburjan: I'm not the one managing this extension  
15:49 <tmortagne> I guess Ludovic wanted to keep previous versions on extensions.xwiki.org on the same page  
15:49 <tmortagne> since the importer cleanup everything it can't find on the repository  
15:55 <sburjan> Ok, I don't fully understand what you're saying, so I won't touch it. I just wanted to fix some bugs... mostly the translation issues  
15:55 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has quit  
15:55 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's very simple, if we remove http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/fveron/ideas/ it will vanish from http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ideas  
15:57 <sburjan> tmortagne: but it seems that the page from extension links to  http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/contrib/application-ideas/  , because the latest version is found here  
15:58 <tmortagne> sburjan: did I talked about the latest version ?  
15:58 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ideas does not only contain a button to the latest version  
15:59 <tmortagne> among other things you have releases notes  
15:59 <sburjan> well then I don't understand why this was not released in the right place in the first time.  
16:00 <tmortagne> sburjan: it was not released at all the first time  
16:00 <tmortagne> like many extensions on extensions.xwiki.org  
16:00 <tmortagne> was just attached to the page  
16:00 <msmeria> has quit  
16:00 <tmortagne> was nowhere in any maven repository  
16:01 <tmortagne> then Ludovic created a proper git repository and started release it on nexus  
16:01 <sburjan> yes, I know about extensions like that. But if we want to keep the old code, I usually commit them in the same repository on contrib, in a separate branch, even if I don't release them  
16:02 <sburjan> so I could continue the development of the extension if I clone the right-repo from contrib ?  
16:02 <tmortagne> sburjan: this version of the extension was installed already, you can't change it's id like this, it was maybe not in a maven repository but it was released from public point of view  
16:02 <tmortagne> it's not about code  
16:02 <tmortagne> where to you see code in that page ?  
16:02 <tmortagne> it's about listing all versions of the extension  
16:03 <tmortagne> and the id of this version was fveron:ideas  
16:03 <sburjan> exactly  
16:03 <sburjan> this is why it ended in the wrong place on maven  
16:03 <sburjan> I guess  
16:03 <tmortagne> so that's where is was deployed...  
16:04 <tmortagne> sburjan: why do you care about this version anyway ?  
16:04 <tmortagne> just continue working on the current git repository  
16:04 <sburjan> because I want to fix some bugs on this application, and I am confused that if I release a newver version, where will the new artifact go ? in the right place, or in the wrong place ?  
16:05 <tmortagne> sburjan: again forget about the old version  
16:05 <sburjan> I see you did a releaese 3 months ago, so I guess they will go in the right place  
16:05 <tmortagne> you don't care what was the id, you modify the current repository and release, done  
16:05 <vmassol> the place is defined in the pom.xml  
16:05 <vmassol> just check the pom  
16:05 <vmassol> (on master)  
16:06 <tmortagne> it's not up to you to decide where you deploy each new version  
16:06 <tmortagne> fix your bug and then release  
16:06 <sburjan> <groupId>org.xwiki.contrib</groupId>  
16:06 <tmortagne> you don't have anything else to worry about  
16:07 <sburjan> ok. Thanks for clearing this out. I was confused because I saw this in the pom.xml <xwiki.extension.features>fveron:ideas</xwiki.extension.features>  
16:07 <vmassol> that's an alias  
16:07 <vmassol> so that EM knows it's the same extension  
16:07 <sburjan> ah, ok. Didn't know that  
16:07 <tmortagne> it just indicate what ids are supported by this extension, for upgrades  
16:11 <sburjan> Thanks tmortagne, vmassol

17:20 <herlo> hello all, I'm working on setting up xwiki on a RHEL 6.5 server with tomcat6 and mysql using the xwiki war. When I start the tomcat server, it deploys the war and then gives the following stack trace: http://ur1.ca/gezyq. I wonder if anyone here can point me in the right direction to fixing this issue.  
17:24 <cjd> Caused by: org.infinispan.jmx.JmxDomainConflictException: Domain already registered org.xwiki.infinispan when trying to register: type=CacheManager,name="XWikiCacheManager"  
17:24 <cjd> herlo: already running xwiki on the same server?  
17:24 <herlo> don't think so  
17:24 <herlo> no other java processes are running  
17:25 <herlo> cjd: double checking  
17:25 <cjd> it looks like maybe 2 xwiki instances in the jvm, is there a .war file and an unpacked .war file both in the webapps directory?  
17:27 <herlo> could be  
17:27 <herlo> cjd: I have a symlink xwiki -> xwiki-enterprise-web-5.3 and xwiki-enterprise-web-5.3.war  
17:27 <herlo> does this seem abnormal?  
17:28 <herlo> If I delete the xwiki-enterprise-web-5.3 and restart tomcat, the directory comes back iirc.  
17:29 <vmassol> it'sok, the servlet container expands it  
17:29 <vmassol> but  
17:29 <vmassol> you should name it xwiki  
17:29 <vmassol> and not xwiki-enterprise-web-5.3  
17:29 <cjd> I'm not a tomcat expert myself but what I'd do is move the .war file out of that directory  
17:29 <cjd> and yes, rename the xwiki-enterprise... as just xwiki  
17:30 <herlo> okay, so I'm trying to automate this into an rpm  
17:30 <herlo> seems silly that I should need to do that after the fact. I'd like it to just work (tm).  
17:30 <cjd> +1 that  
17:31 <vmassol> AFAIK tomcat will use that name as the servlet context by default  
17:31 <vmassol> unless you also provide a tomcat xml config file for it I believe  
17:31 <herlo> vmassol: xwiki?  
17:31 <vmassol> the name of the WAR  
17:31 <herlo> vmassol: so if I deploy the WAR as xwiki.war it should just use that?  
17:32 <herlo> vmassol: because I can do that pretty easily.  
17:32 <tmortagne> herlo: tomcat loads everything it find, including WAR so from it's point of view you have several apps here  
17:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: not quite  
17:32 <vmassol> if the directory and the WAR have the same prefix name it's only deployed once  
17:32 <vmassol> (AFAIK)  
17:33 <vmassol> I may be wrong though  
17:33 <tmortagne> does not seems to be the case here  
17:33 <vmassol> in any case be on the safe side for sure  
17:33 <tmortagne> since the error definitely means thet you have several XWiki  
17:33 <cjd> herlo's stack trace indicates otherwis  
17:33 <vmassol> since it auto unacks it by itself  
17:33 <vmassol> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5213699/why-is-my-war-file-automatically-exploded-in-tomcat  
17:34 <tmortagne> herlo: if you want to write a rpm you could look at what the official deb package does  
17:34 <herlo> tmortagne: hmm...  
17:34 <herlo> tmortagne: do you know where that might reside? I'm sure i could hunt it down if necessary...

17:34 <tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/tree/master/xwiki-enterprise-installers/xwiki-enterprise-installer-debian
